item.title: Between null and positive infinity
item.description: Problem I happen to create a construction like this: if(object?.value > 0) { println "do something" } else { println "do nothing" } Are you sure what will be printed when object is null? I must say I wasnâ€™t. We got used to negate null in groovy like this: assert !null == true but what about using null with relation operator? Comparing null Let us review below code: assert null < 0 assert null < Integer.
